intro: Moraea neglecta, commonly known as the neglected moraea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Iridaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and rocky soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its flowers are usually small and pale, with a distinctive three-lobed structure. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
